data.title: Macrolife by George Zebrowski: Hardcover (1990) Collector's Edition., Signed by Author(s)
data.meta_description: Signed by Author(s) - Collector's Edition. - Hardcover - The Easton Press,, Norwalk, Conn.: - 1990 - Fine in full light brown leather covered boards with three raised bands on the spine with gilt text and decorations stamped in the compartments and with gilt tool work on both the front and rear boards. The end papers are silk with a matching silk placement ribbon sewn-in at the head of the spine. All three edges of the text block are in gilt. An octavo measuring 9" by 6" deep containing 279 pages of text. Signed by the author on the second free end page and laid-in is the two page notes from the publisher. Illustrated with drawings by Rick Sternbach and with an introduction by Ian Watson. One of the volumes in The Easton Press' collection of Masterpieces of Science Fiction. A very handsome, tight, clean copy with no names, dates, notations or former owner's book plates. - Macrolife
data.text:
Terms of Sale:

Check or Money Order with purchase. We also accept Visa, Master Charge, American Express and Discover. If you have a question about one of our books feel free to call us at (860) 526-3896 between 8:30 AM and 9:30 PM EST any day of the week. We also have a secure server attached to our web site should you need to employ that service to send us any confidential data.

Connecticut Residents: Please add 6.35% sales tax.

Hold Policy: We will hold books for 10 days for arrival of check or money order. ...

More Information

Shipping Terms:

Delivery within the US: $16.00 for Priority delivery for 1st book $5.00 for each book thereafter. $5.00 for Book Rate (Media Mail) for the first book and $2.00 for each additional book.

Canadian or Overseas Deliveries will be at cost. Connecticut residents please add 6.35% state sales tax.

Orders usually ship within 1 to 2 business days. Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 LB, or 1 KG. If your book order is heavy or over-sized, we may contact you to let you know extra shipping cost are required. Virtually all of the books we send out are first wrapped in tissue paper, then bubble wrapped and shipped in sturdy boxes.
